actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on August 6, 2024.

actions-list.header: State and Local Law Enforcement Congressional Badge of Bravery Board
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 203(c) of the Law Enforcement Congressional Badge of Bravery Act of 2008 (34 U.S.C. 50323), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker and the Democratic Leader appointed Stephen Wayne Prator, Shreveport, Louisiana.

actions-list.header: Federal Law Enforcement Congressional Badge of Bravery Board
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 103(c) of the Law Enforcement Congressional Badge of Bravery Act of 2008 (34 U.S.C. 50313), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker and the Democratic Leader appointed Mr. Mike Thompson, St. Helena, California.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on July 31, 2024, at 3:53 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 133, S. 134, and the Senate agreed to the House amendment with amendments to S. 2073.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Debbie Lesko to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
